bug.author: mmirtcho
bug.summary: [Bug] Example for Deep Kernel Learning is out of date.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When running the CIFAR 10 example, it gives a shape mismatch error. <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run this line by line in iPython (use dataset = 'cifar10' as in the example): <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/blob/master/examples/08_Deep_Kernel_Learning/Deep_Kernel_Learning_DenseNet_CIFAR_Tutorial.ipynb>https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/blob/master/examples/08_Deep_Kernel_Learning/Deep_Kernel_Learning_DenseNet_CIFAR_Tutorial.ipynb</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code> ** Stack trace/error message **
49 def initialize_variational_distribution(self, prior_dist): ---> 50 self.variational_mean.data.copy_(prior_dist.mean) 51 self.variational_mean.data.add_(self.mean_init_std, torch.randn_like(prior_dist.mean)) 52 self.chol_variational_covar.data.copy_(prior_dist.lazy_covariance_matrix.cholesky().evaluate())
RuntimeError: output with shape [64] doesn't match the broadcast shape [132, 64] </denchmark-code>
from <denchmark-code>gpytorch/variational/cholesky_variational_distribution.py in initialize_variational_distribution(self, prior_dist) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
It should train a DKL, but errors when training. <denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
Please complete the following information:
0.3.6
1.3.1
Ubuntu 16.04.6
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment:
I think the issue is using gpytorch.models.ApproximateGP instead of gpytorch.models.AdditiveGridInducingVariationalGP
I used it with gpytorch.models.AbstractVariationalGP.

I think the issue is using gpytorch.models.ApproximateGP instead of gpytorch.models.AdditiveGridInducingVariationalGP
I used it with gpytorch.models.AbstractVariationalGP.
I still get the same error when using gpytorch.models.AbstractVariationalGP
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mmirtcho>@mmirtcho</denchmark-link> - the examples on the master branch need to be updated to match the variational refactors. This should happen shortly.
